DataElement.preferredName: Tricuspid Valve Regurgitation Velocity Echocardiography Performed 0 Decimal Place Meter per Second Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 0 decimal place numeric value measured, assigned or computed related to the echocardiography assessment of the tricuspid valve regurgitation velocity.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tricuspid Valve Regurgitation Velocity Echocardiography Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A measurement of the backward flow of blood through the tricuspid valve during right ventricle contraction. It correlates with pulmonary artery systolic pressure at rest and with exercise. A tricuspid regurgitation velocity greater than or equal to 2.5 m/sec on echocardiography is a surrogate marker for pulmonary hypertension in adults with sickle cell disease._A test that uses high-frequency sound waves (ultrasound) to create an image of the heart._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A measurement of the backward flow of blood through the tricuspid valve during right ventricle contraction. It correlates with pulmonary artery systolic pressure at rest and with exercise. A tricuspid regurgitation velocity greater than or equal to 2.5 m/sec on echocardiography is a surrogate marker for pulmonary hypertension in adults with sickle cell disease.

Concepts.definition: A measurement of the backward flow of blood through the tricuspid valve during right ventricle contraction. It correlates with pulmonary artery systolic pressure at rest and with exercise. A tricuspid regurgitation velocity greater than or equal to 2.5 m/sec on echocardiography is a surrogate marker for pulmonary hypertension in adults with sickle cell disease.

Property.preferredDefinition: A test that uses high-frequency sound waves (ultrasound) to create an image of the heart.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: A procedure that uses high-frequency sound waves (ultrasound) to create an image of the heart.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: 0 Decimal Place Meter per Second Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A SI derived unit of both speed (scalar) and velocity (vector), defined as the distance of one meter travelled per unit time equal to one second._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A SI derived unit of both speed (scalar) and velocity (vector), defined as the distance of one meter travelled per unit time equal to one second.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
